body.name: To Dream Of Shadows: A Gripping Holocaust Novel Inspired by a Heartbreaking True Story (World War II Historical Fiction Book 1)

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I truly enjoyed this book, very well written andsensitive to the time it was written about . I would recommend it to everyone .

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A Dream of Shadows
reviews.reviewText: I really enjoyed this book, once started it was hard to put down. This is a great book for reading right now given the growing antisemitism. People are people no matter what the differences.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars a real thriller.
reviews.reviewText: I couldn’t put it down. It made the story so real. Then I realized it was real with fictional characters. Well written and exciting to the end. I can’t wait to read his next book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fast Reading Reveals Holocaust Horrors
reviews.reviewText: This is a different Holocaust recounting. The characters come to life instantly—the pain, the terror, the glimpses of how even one person can make a difference. It’s a story of how humans can be the cruelest imaginable and others can still be kind in the midst of terror.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I have read a number of historically based accounts of WWII. This was very well done with a great ending.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars interesting story line
reviews.reviewText: Enjoyed this the story but the language used was off putting. By that I mean too much of the dialogue was way too modern. Expressions used by some characters were just not believable. Inga came over at times like a “smart-ass” which is different from acting defiant. Better read if dialogue was more suited to time period.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Far exceeded my expectations...
reviews.reviewText: To Dream of Shadows tackled an extremely well known and heavily documented subject that is the Holocaust in this engaging story. Steve N. Lee is a wonderful writer and I ate this book up. Truthfully, I have read countless books on the Holocaust and World War 2, both fiction and non-fiction, and I was desperately searching for an exciting and well written story. Truthfully, for every unforgettable literary experience that exists, there are at least 5 maddeningly unreadable books masquerading as "gripping, heartbreaking, unforgettable" books destined to be best sellers. Cautiously optimistic when I began this book, but not expecting sparks, I knew after chapter 2 that this book would be a drink of fresh water in my current reading desert. I am honestly thrilled that this book was MUCH BETTER than I was expecting. Not only was it engrossing and well written, it gave me hope that I have not, as I truly despaired, read all the best World War 2 and Holocaust fiction ever written and that I would have to settle for mediocre and stale stories. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because I rate most fiction by comparing it to my most beloved and 5 star literary giants that include authors Ken Follett, Alice Hoffman, Simon Seabag Montefiore, and Leigh Bardugo. A rating of one star less than I would give my favorite author, Ken Follett, is a true testament of author, Steve Lee's, ability to create an unforgettable story. And, no, I was not paid to write this review. I just want to give credit where credit is due. Enjoy!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Hard to put down…
reviews.reviewText: This book was captivating in its telling the story of the forbidden relationship that was formed between a Jewish woman in a concentration camp in Estonia and the German Kommandant. Being based on a true story made it even more compelling.
This was a wonderful extension to the story, and added so much depth to a persons understanding.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on May 18, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The story follows Inge who learns very quickly how to adapt in order to survive the horrors the Nazi's inflict on ' subhumans'.Alongside this, there is Rudi, second in command of a concentration camp, and his faithful, obedient dog, Bruno. I found myself questioning, how could I like this man? when he is SS.They come together when Inge - and other women - are marched on a harrowing journey to join this camp.Knowing they can never openly be together, Rudi hatches a daring plan which has equal chances of success and failure.Will they succeed? And have the life they deserve. Or is the plan too flawed? Rudi knows they won't be 'lucky' enough to have a straight forward execution if caught!I thoroughly recommend you read their story.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 21, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Such a powerful book not just a love story it literally horrified and fills you with anxiety aswell , amazing I couldn't put it down

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on June 24, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Some of the dialogue is not of the time period and the "smart mouth" interaction of Inge with the SS command seems to be somewhat ridiculous. A story that reputedly has some historical basis but a disappointment nonetheless.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on June 14, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I’ve just finished this book and it has a cracking ending that has left me wanting to know more about the real life characters. I applaud the author for the level of his research throughout the entire book. I thought that I already had my favourite author of holocaust related stories but this has eclipsed it. I can’t recommend this book enough.
